page.title: 07Religion in Bwlchysarnau
page.content: Religion plays an important role in the lives of most of the inhabitants of this area.Many people still attend the Baptist Church in the village, built in 1829, 3 times during Sundays for Sunday school and 2 preaching services. The old traditions of Sunday school Anniversaries, Revival meetings Choral festivals and the 'Christmas tree', a nativity service performed by the Sunday school children with presents for good attendance distributd afterwards still prevail as does the practice of Baptism by total immersion in the River Marteg. But there are signs of change with interest becoming apparent by younger members in the Pentecostal form of worship, conflicting with the ideas of the deacons. It remains to be seen whether the church will have to adapt to survive in the next few years.
